title: Editors Choice Pictures
text:
Pictures | Thu May 3, 2018 | 4:10pm EDT Editors Choice Pictures
With the U.S. Capitol in the background, Kellye Sims flips her hair up as she basks in the sun, at the National Mall, during a record-setting heat wave in Washington, D.C. REUTERS/Kevin Lamarque Reuters / Thursday, May 03, 2018 With the U.S. Capitol in the background, Kellye Sims flips her hair up as she basks in the sun, at the National Mall, during a record-setting heat wave in Washington, D.C. REUTERS/Kevin Lamarque Close 1 / 29
A border patrol agent apprehends a woman and a man after they were caught illegally crossing into the U.S. border from Mexico near McAllen, Texas. REUTERS/Adrees Latif Reuters / Wednesday, May 02, 2018 A border patrol agent apprehends a woman and a man after they were caught illegally crossing into the U.S. border from Mexico near McAllen, Texas. REUTERS/Adrees Latif Close 2 / 29
The sun is seen rising over skyscrapers in the City of London financial district. REUTERS/Toby Melville Reuters / Thursday, May 03, 2018 The sun is seen rising over skyscrapers in the City of London financial district. REUTERS/Toby Melville Close 3 / 29
A man evacuates his horse from the area as the fire burns through a pile of old tyres at a recycling centre in Ciudad Juarez, Mexico. REUTERS/Jose Luis Gonzalez Reuters / Wednesday, May 02, 2018 A man evacuates his horse from the area as the fire burns through a pile of old tyres at a recycling centre in Ciudad Juarez, Mexico. REUTERS/Jose Luis Gonzalez Close 4 / 29
A firefighter looks at a church and a building that caught fire and collapsed in the center of Sao Paulo, Brazil. REUTERS/Nacho Doce Reuters / Wednesday, May 02, 2018 A firefighter looks at a church and a building that caught fire and collapsed in the center of Sao Paulo, Brazil. REUTERS/Nacho Doce Close 5 / 29
Syrian refugees who crossed the Evros river, the natural border between Greece and Turkey, board a police truck transferring them to a first reception centre, near the village of Nea Vyssa, Greece. REUTERS/Alkis Konstantinidis Reuters / Thursday, May 03, 2018 Syrian refugees who crossed the Evros river, the natural border between Greece and Turkey, board a police truck transferring them to a first reception centre, near the village of Nea Vyssa, Greece. REUTERS/Alkis Konstantinidis Close 6 / 29
Palestinians with their faces painted like characters from the movie Avatar take part in a protest demanding the right to return to their homeland, at the Israel-Gaza border in the southern Gaza Strip. REUTERS/Ibraheem Abu Mustafa Reuters / Thursday, May 03, 2018 Palestinians with their faces painted like characters from the movie Avatar take part in a protest demanding the right to return to their homeland, at the Israel-Gaza border in the southern Gaza Strip. REUTERS/Ibraheem Abu Mustafa Close 7 / 29
Ultra-Orthodox Jews look at a bonfire as they celebrate the Jewish holiday of Lag Ba'Omer in the city of Ashdod, Israel. REUTERS/Amir Cohen Reuters / Wednesday, May 02, 2018 Ultra-Orthodox Jews look at a bonfire as they celebrate the Jewish holiday of Lag Ba'Omer in the city of Ashdod, Israel. REUTERS/Amir Cohen Close 8 / 29
Supporters of Venezuela's President Nicolas Maduro holding a cardboard cut-out and a painting depicting Venezuela's late President Hugo Chavez attend a campaign rally in La Guaira, Venezuela. REUTERS/Carlos Garcia Rawlins Reuters / Thursday, May 03, 2018 Supporters of Venezuela's President Nicolas Maduro holding a cardboard cut-out and a painting depicting Venezuela's late President Hugo Chavez attend a campaign rally in La Guaira, Venezuela. REUTERS/Carlos Garcia Rawlins Close 9 / 29
Venezuelan refugee Gabriela Martinez, who worked as a telecommunications engineer, relaxes in a hammock near a bus station in Manaus, Brazil. REUTERS/Bruno Kelly Reuters / Thursday, May 03, 2018 Venezuelan refugee Gabriela Martinez, who worked as a telecommunications engineer, relaxes in a hammock near a bus station in Manaus, Brazil. REUTERS/Bruno Kelly Close 10 / 29
People are seen through a bullet hole in a window of a damaged house after a gun battle between suspected militants and Indian security forces at Turkewangam village in Kashmir's Shopian district. REUTERS/Danish Ismail Reuters / Thursday, May 03, 2018 People are seen through a bullet hole in a window of a damaged house after a gun battle between suspected militants and Indian security forces at Turkewangam village in Kashmir's Shopian district. REUTERS/Danish Ismail Close
The site of a military plane crash is seen in Savannah, Georgia. JAMES LAVINE/via REUTERS Reuters / Wednesday, May 02, 2018 The site of a military plane crash is seen in Savannah, Georgia. JAMES LAVINE/via REUTERS Close 12 / 29
A security personnel inspects the site of a suicide attack on the electoral commission in Tripoli, Libya. REUTERS/Ismail Zitouny Reuters / Wednesday, May 02, 2018 A security personnel inspects the site of a suicide attack on the electoral commission in Tripoli, Libya. REUTERS/Ismail Zitouny Close 13 / 29
U.S. President Donald Trump presents the National Teacher of the Year award to Mandy Manning accompanied by Education Secretary Betsy DeVos at the East Room Wednesday, May 02, 2018 U.S. President Donald Trump presents the National Teacher of the Year award to Mandy Manning accompanied by Education Secretary Betsy DeVos at the East Room
A British Airways passenger plane flies in front of the moon above London. REUTERS/Toby Melville Reuters / Thursday, May 03, 2018 A British Airways passenger plane flies in front of the moon above London. REUTERS/Toby Melville Close
Roma fans inside the stadium before their match against Liverpool. REUTERS/Max Rossi Reuters / Wednesday, May 02, 2018 Roma fans inside the stadium before their match against Liverpool. REUTERS/Max Rossi Close 16 / 29
 17 / 29
Relatives mourn during the funeral of Palestinian Anas Abu Aser, who died of wounds he sustained during a protest at the Israel-Gaza border, in Gaza City May 3, 2018. REUTERS/Mohammed Salem TPX IMAGES OF THE DAY Reuters / Thursday, May 03, 2018 Relatives mourn during the funeral of Palestinian Anas Abu Aser, who died of wounds he sustained during a protest at the Israel-Gaza border, in Gaza City May 3, 2018. REUTERS/Mohammed Salem TPX IMAGES OF THE DAY Close 18 / 29
A farmer, also known as a jimador clears the area surrounding blue agave before it is harvested in Tepatitlan, Jalisco, Mexico. REUTERS/Carlos Jasso Reuters / Wednesday, May 02, 2018 A farmer, also known as a jimador clears the area surrounding blue agave before it is harvested in Tepatitlan, Jalisco, Mexico. REUTERS/Carlos Jasso Close
A farmer shows his newborn pet guinea pigs in Santo Domingo, Cuba. REUTERS/Alexandre Meneghini Reuters / Wednesday, May 02, 2018 A farmer shows his newborn pet guinea pigs in Santo Domingo, Cuba. REUTERS/Alexandre Meneghini Close 20 / 29
U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo laughs as President Donald Trump speaks during a swearing-in ceremony for Pompeo at the State Department in Washington. REUTERS/Jonathan Ernst Reuters / Wednesday, May 02, 2018 U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo laughs as President Donald Trump speaks during a swearing-in ceremony for Pompeo at the State Department in Washington. REUTERS/Jonathan Ernst Close 21 / 29
Members of a caravan of migrants from Central America enter the United States border and customs facility, where they are expected to apply for asylum, Wednesday, May 02, 2018 Members of a caravan of migrants from Central America enter the United States border and customs facility, where they are expected to apply for asylum, 22 / 29
A man is attacked by kangaroos after feeding them near Morisset Park, Australia. Kroosn Shuttle Service Pty Ltd/via REUTERS Reuters / Thursday, May 03, 2018 A man is attacked by kangaroos after feeding them near Morisset Park, Australia. Kroosn Shuttle Service Pty Ltd/via REUTERS Close 23 / 29
Maria (second name withheld), holds a picture of a prisoner held for collaboration with armed Basque separatists ETA, during a protest in favor of prisoners in Bilbao, Spain. REUTERS/Vincent West Reuters / Wednesday, May 02, 2018 Maria (second name withheld), holds a picture of a prisoner held for collaboration with armed Basque separatists ETA, during a protest in favor of prisoners in Bilbao, Spain. REUTERS/Vincent West Close 24 / 29
A firefighter works to extinguish the fire as it burns through a pile of old tires at a recycling centre in Ciudad Juarez, Mexico. REUTERS/Jose Luis Gonzalez Reuters / Thursday, May 03, 2018 A firefighter works to extinguish the fire as it burns through a pile of old tires at a recycling centre in Ciudad Juarez, Mexico. REUTERS/Jose Luis Gonzalez Close 25 / 29
A woman walks past servicemen of the self-proclaimed Donetsk People�s Republic (DNR), who take part in a rehearsal for the Victory Day parade in Donetsk, Ukraine. REUTERS/Alexander Ermochenko Reuters / Thursday, May 03, 2018 A woman walks past servicemen of the self-proclaimed Donetsk People�s Republic (DNR), who take part in a rehearsal for the Victory Day parade in Donetsk, Ukraine. REUTERS/Alexander Ermochenko Close 26 / 29
A girl from a homeless family, that was living in the building that caught on fire, sits on her mattress donated by well-wishers in front of a church at Largo do Paissandu Square in Sao Paulo, Brazil. REUTERS/Nacho Doce Reuters / Thursday, May 03, 2018 A girl from a homeless family, that was living in the building that caught on fire, sits on her mattress donated by well-wishers in front of a church at Largo do Paissandu Square in Sao Paulo, Brazil. REUTERS/Nacho Doce Close 27 / 29
Detained and handcuffed Reuters journalist Kyaw Soe Oo carries his daughter Moe Thin Wai Zin while arriving for a court hearing in Yangon, Myanmar. REUTERS/Ann Wang Reuters / Wednesday, May 02, 2018 Detained and handcuffed Reuters journalist Kyaw Soe Oo carries his daughter Moe Thin Wai Zin while arriving for a court hearing in Yangon, Myanmar. REUTERS/Ann Wang Close 28 / 29
